message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new regularization technique for improving the generalization performance of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) on sequential data. The paper also mentions the use of semi-supervised text classification tasks and language modeling tasks, which are common applications of machine learning. 

The paper also involves the processing of text and speech data, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language). 

The use of dropout techniques and neural networks suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper's focus on image classification tasks, such as sequential MNIST tasks, suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). 

Finally, the paper's use of recurrent neural networks suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
